logo: Proxmox Control Server Command Line Interface
about: PCSCLI - Proxmox Control Server Command Line Interface
A lightweight CLI for managing Proxmox cluster nodes via IPMI commands.
help_msg: General Commands:
exit, quit      - Close the PCSCLI session.
about           - Display information about PCSCLI.
help, -help     - Show help for available commands.
clear           - Clear the terminal screen.
Command Structure:
[prefix] [command] {options} <-i ID>
Use '-help' with any command for detailed usage.
Available Commands:
pcscli
cmd            - Execute a direct ipmitool command.
set
power on       - Turn on power for a node.
power off      - Turn off power for a node.
sys led on     - Turn on the chassis attention LED.
sys led off    - Turn off the chassis attention LED.
sys sel clear  - Clear the node's SEL log.
sh
sys info       - Show system information.
sys fru        - Display FRU (Field Replaceable Unit) information.
sys sel        - Show the node's SEL log.
sys sdr        - Display the node's Sensor Data Record (SDR).
Example Usage:
sh sys info -i 1      # Show system info for node 1
set power on -i 2     # Turn on power for node 2
pcscli cmd user list -i 1  # Execute direct ipmitool command
Type 'help' or '-help' for more details on specific commands.
